original: de'i de nyid bde bar dang stong pa dbyer med pa'i nyams myong drod rtags 'char ba la cho gar bshad ces sku gsung thugs gnyis med ye shes grub pa'i thabs su bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i de nyid bde bar dang stong pa dbyer med pa'i nyams myong drod rtags 'char ba la cho gar bshad ces sku gsung thugs gnyis med ye shes grub pa'i thabs su bstan pa'o //
translated: The experience of the indivisibility of bliss and emptiness of that is explained as the signs of warmth arising, which is taught as the method for accomplishing the gnosis of the nondual body, speech, and mind.üîΩNow, in order to explain the actual pledges to be guarded,

original: da ni bsrung bar bya ba'i dam tshig dngos bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bsrung bar bya ba'i dam tshig dngos bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it says:

original: de nas rnal 'byor rgyud 'dir ni //
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor rgyud 'dir ni //
translated: Then, in this yoga tantra,

original: rnyed dka'i dam tshig da yis bshad //
analyzed: rnyed dka'i dam tshig da yis bshad //
translated: I will explain the pledges that are difficult to obtain.

original: ces pas / thun mong gi rgyud las mchog tu 'gyur ba'i thabs shes rab gnyis med ston pa'i rgyud 'dir ni /
analyzed: ces pas / thun mong gi rgyud las mchog tu 'gyur ba'i thabs shes rab gnyis med ston pa'i rgyud 'dir ni /
translated: In this tantra, which teaches the method of nondual wisdom that is superior to the common tantras,

original: skal pa dang mi ldan pas rnyed dka' ba'i dam tshig khyad par ba nga yis bshad ces pas /
analyzed: skal pa dang mi ldan pas rnyed dka' ba'i dam tshig khyad par ba nga yis bshad ces pas /
translated: I will explain the special pledges that are difficult for those who are unfortunate to obtain.

original: dam tshig gi ngo bo sgra 'jug pa dang / byed las dbye ba mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir thabs /
analyzed: dam tshig gi ngo bo sgra 'jug pa dang / byed las dbye ba mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir thabs /
translated: The essence of the pledges is to engage in the terms, the function is the divisions, and the method for not degenerating is the means.

original: nyams na phyir bcos pa la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: nyams na phyir bcos pa la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: If there is degeneration, one should engage in the restoration.

original: de la thog mar rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud du shes rab kho na gtso che bar bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩskyes pa bud med g-yon nas 'gro //
analyzed: de la thog mar rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud du shes rab kho na gtso che bar bstan pa'i phyir / skyes pa bud med g-yon nas 'gro //
translated: In order to demonstrate that only wisdom is preeminent in the Yoginƒ´ Tantras,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúA man or woman should go to the left.

original: zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes pa smos te /
translated: This is the second chapter, the chapter on the benefits of bodhicitta.

original: gang yang ngo bo nyid kyis rdo rje rnal 'byor ma mdzes ma'i bdag nyid bde chen po dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: gang yang ngo bo nyid kyis rdo rje rnal 'byor ma mdzes ma'i bdag nyid bde chen po dang ldan pa ni /
translated: Moreover, one who is endowed with the nature of Vajrayoginƒ´, the beautiful one, and with great bliss,

original: g-yon pa'i kun du spyod pa la ni gnas pas bde stong dbyer med du gnas pa'i brda go bar bya'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i kun du spyod pa la ni gnas pas bde stong dbyer med du gnas pa'i brda go bar bya'o //
translated: should abide in the conduct of the left, in order to understand the symbol of abiding in the indivisibility of bliss and emptiness.

original: des rigs ldan rnams ni mchod par bya //
analyzed: des rigs ldan rnams ni mchod par bya //
translated: ‚Äú One should worship the yoginƒ´s‚Äù

original: zhes pas rigs ldan ye shes kyi lha mo mdzes ma rnams stong pa nyid bcu drug gi ngo bo mchod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pas rigs ldan ye shes kyi lha mo mdzes ma rnams stong pa nyid bcu drug gi ngo bo mchod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: means that the beautiful goddesses of the wisdom deities, the yoginƒ´s, will be worshipped, who are the nature of the sixteen emptinesses.

original: de'i phan yon ni /
analyzed: de'i phan yon ni /
translated: The benefit of that is

original: 'dod pa'i dngos grub ster bar byed //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dngos grub ster bar byed //
translated: ‚Äúthey bestow the desired powers.‚Äù

original: ces pa gnas skabs dang mthar thug tu bla ma med pa'i don stsol bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ces pa gnas skabs dang mthar thug tu bla ma med pa'i don stsol bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúwithout a guru‚Äù is that they will bestow the temporary and ultimate.

original: dpal 'khor lo sngom pa'i rgyud 'dir zhugs shing gnas pa mchod par 'os pa la dus rnams kun du @71b mchod par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dpal 'khor lo sngom pa'i rgyud 'dir zhugs shing gnas pa mchod par 'os pa la dus rnams kun du @71b mchod par bstan pa ni /
translated: The one who has entered and abides in this tantra of Sri Heruka, who is worthy of worship, is shown to be worshipped at all times.

original: he ru ka dpal rnal 'byor mchog ni rim pa gnyis lag nas pa'i gang zag de brtul zhugs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: he ru ka dpal rnal 'byor mchog ni rim pa gnyis lag nas pa'i gang zag de brtul zhugs dang ldan pa /
translated: The supreme yoga of Sri Heruka is the person who has the two stages in hand and is endowed with spiritual practice.

original: de las sbyor gzhan med pa ni 'khor ba las skyob pa mnyen pa lta bu yin pa'o //
analyzed: de las sbyor gzhan med pa ni 'khor ba las skyob pa mnyen pa lta bu yin pa'o //
translated: Not having any other application than that is like a protector, saving from cyclic existence.

original: slob dpon de rang gi rgyud la yon tan bskyed cing yang dag pa'i lam la khrid pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon de rang gi rgyud la yon tan bskyed cing yang dag pa'i lam la khrid pa'o //
translated: That master generates the qualities in one's own continuum and guides one on the true path.

original: gsang ba'i dbang gi dus su ni rnal 'byor ma de nyid kun gyi yum ye shes skyed byed yin /
analyzed: gsang ba'i dbang gi dus su ni rnal 'byor ma de nyid kun gyi yum ye shes skyed byed yin /
translated: At the time of the secret empowerment, that yoginl is the mother of all, the producer of exalted wisdom.

original: slob ma'i khams rgyud byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: slob ma'i khams rgyud byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: The disciple's continuum is empowered.

original: khyim dang zhing du rnam par gnas pa ni 'khor lo lnga la gnas pa'i phyi nang gi rdo rje rnal 'byor ma pho nya lhan cig skyes ma la sogs pa rnams kyis sgrub pa po rnams shin tu ring ba 'og min la sogs pa na gnas kyang shes
analyzed: khyim dang zhing du rnam par gnas pa ni 'khor lo lnga la gnas pa'i phyi nang gi rdo rje rnal 'byor ma pho nya lhan cig skyes ma la sogs pa rnams kyis sgrub pa po rnams shin tu ring ba 'og min la sogs pa na gnas kyang shes
translated: Those who dwell in the house and field are the outer and inner Vajrayoginis dwelling in the five chakras, the messengers, the coemergent ones, and so on, who cause the practitioners to know, even though they dwell far away in Akani·π£·π≠ha and so on,

original: par 'gyur ba ni mngon par shes pas so //
analyzed: par 'gyur ba ni mngon par shes pas so //
translated: through clairvoyance.

original: yang na rnal 'byor pas lhan cig skyes ma dang / zhing skyes ma rtags kyi sgo nas shes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor pas lhan cig skyes ma dang / zhing skyes ma rtags kyi sgo nas shes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, the yogi will know the coemergent and field-born yoginis through the signs.

original: dpal bde mchog gi rgyud 'di ru ni gang zhugs pa de dag sgrub pa po khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: dpal bde mchog gi rgyud 'di ru ni gang zhugs pa de dag sgrub pa po khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
translated: In this glorious Cakrasa·πÉvara Tantra, those who enter it are special practitioners.

original: nges par logs pa'i lam khyad par ba la gnas par 'gyur ba nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: nges par logs pa'i lam khyad par ba la gnas par 'gyur ba nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to make them understand that they will definitely come to dwell on the special path of liberation,

original: bla ma dang mchod par 'os pa rdo rje sbun la sogs pa la brnyas mi bya zhing spang mi bya /
analyzed: bla ma dang mchod par 'os pa rdo rje sbun la sogs pa la brnyas mi bya zhing spang mi bya /
translated: they should not disrespect or abandon the guru and those worthy of worship, such as the vajra siblings.

original: lus kyis gus 'dud /
analyzed: lus kyis gus 'dud /
translated: They should physically bow down to them.

original: ngang gis snyan pa brjod /
analyzed: ngang gis snyan pa brjod /
translated: They should speak to them in a pleasant manner.

original: sems kyis snying brtse bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems kyis snying brtse bar bya ba ste /
translated: One should have compassion for them.üîΩ

original: nus pa yis ni mchod par bya ba lhag pa'i lha dang dbyer med du blta bas tshes bcu phrag gnyis la sogs pa la mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: nus pa yis ni mchod par bya ba lhag pa'i lha dang dbyer med du blta bas tshes bcu phrag gnyis la sogs pa la mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings on the two tenth days of the lunar month and so forth, with the attitude of loving kindness toward the dakinis, with the attitude of devotion toward the teacher, with the attitude of respect toward the assembly of dakinis, with the attitude of compassion toward sentient beings, with the attitude of worship toward the supreme deity, and with the attitude of inseparability from the supreme deity.

original: shes rab kyi rang bzhin d'a ki ma'i tshogs la ma gus pa spang zhing gus pa bsgrub pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi rang bzhin d'a ki ma'i tshogs la ma gus pa spang zhing gus pa bsgrub pa ni /
translated: One should avoid disrespect and cultivate respect for the assembly of dakinis, who are the embodiment of wisdom.

original: khva gdong la sogs brgyad po ni //
analyzed: khva gdong la sogs brgyad po ni //
translated: The eight dakinis, such as Khakarma,

original: zhes pas d'a ki de dag dang chos mthun du gyur pa'i sems can dud 'gro'i skye gnas la yang mi smad na mir gyur pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: zhes pas d'a ki de dag dang chos mthun du gyur pa'i sems can dud 'gro'i skye gnas la yang mi smad na mir gyur pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: are the embodiment of the dakinis. One should not disparage sentient beings who are born as animals, who are similar to those dakinis. What need is there to mention humans?

original: gal te smad par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //üîΩde nyid la gus pas nus pa ni rnam shes kyi las mos pa 'phel bas las ma dag pa dag la /
analyzed: gal te smad par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o // de nyid la gus pas nus pa ni rnam shes kyi las mos pa 'phel bas las ma dag pa dag la /
translated: If one disparages them, one commits a fault.üîΩOne should cultivate respect for them.üîΩOne should increase one‚Äôs faith in those whose karma is impure.

original: dad pa 'phel bar byed pa ye shes kyi las kyi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa 'phel bar byed pa ye shes kyi las kyi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dag par byed pa'o //
translated: One should increase one‚Äôs wisdom, which purifies the obscurations of affliction.

original: dus rgyun chad med par rtag par dngos grub gnyis la sogs pa rnams thob par byed pa dag gi rgyu'am gzhi rten chos kyi 'byung gnas te /üîΩye shes mchog tu 'gyur ba spros med shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don gyi yum la mos par bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dus rgyun chad med par rtag par dngos grub gnyis la sogs pa rnams thob par byed pa dag gi rgyu'am gzhi rten chos kyi 'byung gnas te / ye shes mchog tu 'gyur ba spros med shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don gyi yum la mos par bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: The source of Dharma is the cause or basis for always and continuously attaining the two types of spiritual powers.üîΩThe supreme wisdom that becomes supreme timeless awareness is the perfection of nonconceptual wisdom.
The meaning of this is to be devoted to the ultimate mother.

original: nyid du dam tshig la gnas pa'i gang zag la dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi thugs kyis rjes su 'dzin pas na /
analyzed: nyid du dam tshig la gnas pa'i gang zag la dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi thugs kyis rjes su 'dzin pas na /
translated: In that very state, the mind of the heroes and yoginƒ´s takes care of the individual who abides in samaya.

original: dam tshig rnams ni skyong byed pa //
analyzed: dam tshig rnams ni skyong byed pa //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúKeep the samayas.‚Äù

original: zhes dpal bde mchog nyid kyis 'gro ba 'dul ba'i don du sna tshogs gzugs can du bstan cing /
analyzed: zhes dpal bde mchog nyid kyis 'gro ba 'dul ba'i don du sna tshogs gzugs can du bstan cing /
translated: Glorious Cakrasa·πÉvara himself taught this in order to guide beings.

original: slob dpon do mbhi bas rtsa ba dang yan lag gi dam tshig thams cad la gnas par bya ba ste /
analyzed: slob dpon do mbhi bas rtsa ba dang yan lag gi dam tshig thams cad la gnas par bya ba ste /
translated: ƒÄcƒÅrya Do·πá·∏çubƒ´ja said that all root and branch samayas should be kept.

original: mnyam rjes gnyis su med pas gnas par bya zhes so //
analyzed: mnyam rjes gnyis su med pas gnas par bya zhes so //
translated: They should be kept with nondual meditative equipoise and post-meditation.

original: khyad par du rigs ldan spang bar mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: khyad par du rigs ldan spang bar mi bya ba ste /
translated: In particular, one should not abandon a person who belongs to the family.

original: lha mo gzhan dang kun sbyor ba //
analyzed: lha mo gzhan dang kun sbyor ba //
translated: One should unite with the other goddesses.

original: zhes bdag nyid dpal he ru kar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bdag nyid dpal he ru kar bya ste /
translated: One should visualize oneself as ≈örƒ´ Heruka.

original: lha mo bcu gnyis po la sogs pa thams cad kyang rdo rje rnal 'byor ma nyid du skyed cing mnyam par sbyor ba las /
analyzed: lha mo bcu gnyis po la sogs pa thams cad kyang rdo rje rnal 'byor ma nyid du skyed cing mnyam par sbyor ba las /
translated: One should generate all the twelve goddesses and so forth as Vajrayoginƒ´ and unite in union.

original: dkyil 'khor du ma gtogs pa gzhan la brten par mi bya ba yul gyi dbye bas shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du ma gtogs pa gzhan la brten par mi bya ba yul gyi dbye bas shes par bya ba'o //
translated: One should understand that one should not rely on anyone else who is not included in the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: 'dod pas chags par bya ba min //
analyzed: 'dod pas chags par bya ba min //
translated: One should not be attached to desire.

original: zhes smos pas /
analyzed: zhes smos pas /
translated: Since it says this,

original: tha mal 'jig rten pa'i spyod pas brten pa ni ltung bar 'gyur bas dgag bya'o //
analyzed: tha mal 'jig rten pa'i spyod pas brten pa ni ltung bar 'gyur bas dgag bya'o //
translated: one should stop relying on ordinary worldly conduct, which is a downfall.

original: da ni bza' bar bya ba'i dam tshig la gnyis su med cas sha lnga bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa la blang dor spangs pas ro mnyam du spyod la /
analyzed: da ni bza' bar bya ba'i dam tshig la gnyis su med cas sha lnga bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa la blang dor spangs pas ro mnyam du spyod la /
translated: Now, in the pledge to be eaten, since there is no duality, one should enjoy the five meats, the five nectars, and so on, as the same taste, abandoning acceptance and rejection.

original: thogs pa med ces gsang bar bya ba'i rdzas dang mchod pa'i yo byad /
analyzed: thogs pa med ces gsang bar bya ba'i rdzas dang mchod pa'i yo byad /
translated: Since there is no obstruction, the substances to be kept secret and the articles for offerings

original: ga na tsa kra'i byed pa dang rten la sogs pa gzhan la mi bstan cing gsang ba bsgrag par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: ga na tsa kra'i byed pa dang rten la sogs pa gzhan la mi bstan cing gsang ba bsgrag par mi bya ba'o //
translated: The performance and support of the ga·πáacakra should not be shown to others, and should not be proclaimed in secret.

original: dam tshig spyod pa'i spyad bya ba ni /
analyzed: dam tshig spyod pa'i spyad bya ba ni /
translated: The conduct of observing the commitments is as follows:

original: dam tshig can legs par brtags pas /
analyzed: dam tshig can legs par brtags pas /
translated: Having thoroughly examined the one who has the commitments,

original: bsnyen sgrub kyi yan lag gis sbyangs nas spyod pa'i rim pa la gnas par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsnyen sgrub kyi yan lag gis sbyangs nas spyod pa'i rim pa la gnas par bya ba'o //
translated: one should train with the limbs of approach and accomplishment, and then abide in the stages of conduct.

original: gsang ba'i spyod pa ye shes bsgrubs pas gnas pa bsten pa'i phyir lha mo'i dbang phyug legs par sbyor ba ni sngags skyes kyi rigs ldan legs par sbyangs pa ste /
analyzed: gsang ba'i spyod pa ye shes bsgrubs pas gnas pa bsten pa'i phyir lha mo'i dbang phyug legs par sbyor ba ni sngags skyes kyi rigs ldan legs par sbyangs pa ste /
translated: In order to abide by relying on the accomplishment of gnosis through secret conduct, the union with the lady of the family is the training of the one born from mantra.

original: dang po gso sbyong sbyin pa nas bslab pa dang / thos bsam dbang dang bsam gtan yab yum gyi snying po dgod pa dang byin gyi rlabs dang ldan pas bsten pa'o //
analyzed: dang po gso sbyong sbyin pa nas bslab pa dang / thos bsam dbang dang bsam gtan yab yum gyi snying po dgod pa dang byin gyi rlabs dang ldan pas bsten pa'o //
translated: From the beginning, one should rely on the one who has been given the purificatory fast, who has the training, who has studied and contemplated, who has the empowerment, and who has the essence of the meditation of the father and mother, and who has been blessed.

original: de bzhin bsam gtan gyi tshangs spyod ces tshad med bzhi dang ldan pas de bzhin nyid lha dang ye shes kyi bsam gtan bde ba la stong pas rgyas 'debs tshangs par spyod pa bde stong gnyis med du gyur pa la sogs pa so so thar pa'i ltung ba
analyzed: de bzhin bsam gtan gyi tshangs spyod ces tshad med bzhi dang ldan pas de bzhin nyid lha dang ye shes kyi bsam gtan bde ba la stong pas rgyas 'debs tshangs par spyod pa bde stong gnyis med du gyur pa la sogs pa so so thar pa'i ltung ba
translated: Likewise, the ‚ÄúBrahmacarya of concentration‚Äù is the concentration of the deity and of pristine awareness, which is the bliss of emptiness. The ‚ÄúBrahmacarya of the vows‚Äù is the nonduality of bliss and emptiness.

original: lta bus gos pa med do //
analyzed: lta bus gos pa med do //
translated: One is not defiled by the downfalls of the Pratimoksha.

original: nyon mongs pa zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩkhro med bu gar kun spyod pa //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir ro // khro med bu gar kun spyod pa //
translated: Because the afflictions are overcome.

original: @72b zhes pa dgos pa dang mi ldan zhing yon tan med bzhin du byang sems rtse mo las dbyung bar mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: @72b zhes pa dgos pa dang mi ldan zhing yon tan med bzhin du byang sems rtse mo las dbyung bar mi bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe conduct in the bhaga without anger‚Äù means that one should not engage in the conduct of the bodhisattva‚Äôs peak experience without a purpose and without the qualities.

original: rten dang brten pa me tog dang dri lta bu ste de dang 'gal na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa me tog dang dri lta bu ste de dang 'gal na ltung ba'o //
translated: The support and the supported are like a flower and its fragrance. If one acts contrary to that, it is a downfall.

original: de'i nyams myong la dad pa nyid kyis gal te ltung na zhes blang gi / mig dang lag pas ma yin no zhes dgag bya'o //
analyzed: de'i nyams myong la dad pa nyid kyis gal te ltung na zhes blang gi / mig dang lag pas ma yin no zhes dgag bya'o //
translated: If one should commit a downfall out of faith in the experience of that, one should confess it, but not with one‚Äôs eyes and hands.

original: de dag gi gzhung nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi gzhung nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize the texts of those,

original: 'di brgyad dam tshig spyod min //
analyzed: 'di brgyad dam tshig spyod min //
translated: These eight are not to be transgressed.

original: zhes pas g-yon pa kun spyod bla ma dang mchod 'os mchod pa /
analyzed: zhes pas g-yon pa kun spyod bla ma dang mchod 'os mchod pa /
translated: Thus, one should not despise the left-hand conduct, the guru and those worthy of worship,

original: sha lnga bdud rtsi la blang dor med pas tshes bcu dang / rgyud 'dir zhugs pa la mi smad pa /
analyzed: sha lnga bdud rtsi la blang dor med pas tshes bcu dang / rgyud 'dir zhugs pa la mi smad pa /
translated: the five meats and the nectars, the tenth day of the lunar month, and those who have entered this tantra.

original: dud 'gro'i skyes gnas la smad pa spang pa /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skyes gnas la smad pa spang pa /
translated: One should avoid despising those born as animals.

original: kunda mi spang zhing spel ba /
analyzed: kunda mi spang zhing spel ba /
translated: One should not abandon or disparage the kunda flower.

original: dam tshig gnyis 'dzin rtog pa spong pa /
analyzed: dam tshig gnyis 'dzin rtog pa spong pa /
translated: One should not hold the two commitments or give up conceptual thought.

original: tshangs par spyod pa can no //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa can no //
translated: One should be celibate.

original: rnal 'byor pas bsnyen pa dang sgrub pa dang / nye bar sgrub pa la gnas pa ni yan lag bzhi ldan du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas bsnyen pa dang sgrub pa dang / nye bar sgrub pa la gnas pa ni yan lag bzhi ldan du spyod pa'o //
translated: The practitioner who abides in the approach, accomplishment, and great accomplishment practices with the four branches.

original: sgrub pa pos ni rtag tu lus kyis mtho ris dang sems kyis thar pa mchog shes pas gnas par bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa pos ni rtag tu lus kyis mtho ris dang sems kyis thar pa mchog shes pas gnas par bya ba'o //
translated: The practitioner should always abide with the body in the higher realms and with the mind in supreme liberation.

original: rgyud rnams thams cad thun mong du ni /
analyzed: rgyud rnams thams cad thun mong du ni /
translated: In all the tantras in common,

original: bya ba spyod pa rnal 'byor bla ma med pa thams cad du dam tshig gsang ba spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba spyod pa rnal 'byor bla ma med pa thams cad du dam tshig gsang ba spyod pa'o //
translated: the secret conduct of the commitments is practiced in all the lower yogas of action tantra and conduct tantra.

original: rgyu med par ni bcom mi bya //
analyzed: rgyu med par ni bcom mi bya //
translated: One should not destroy without a reason.

original: zhes thams cad mkhyen thob par byed pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo sngom pa dang dam tshig la gnas par bya ba /
analyzed: zhes thams cad mkhyen thob par byed pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo sngom pa dang dam tshig la gnas par bya ba /
translated: Thus, the principal cause for attaining omniscience is to abide in the vows and commitments.

original: ltung ba mi bcab yon tan mi bsgrag //
analyzed: ltung ba mi bcab yon tan mi bsgrag //
translated: Do not conceal downfalls, do not proclaim good qualities,

original: bsam gtan la gnas pa la bslab pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan la gnas pa la bslab pa'o //
translated: and train in abiding in meditative concentration.

original: bde ba khyad par grub pa nye bar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: bde ba khyad par grub pa nye bar gyur pa ni /
translated: The attainment of the special bliss is

original: pho nya ma rnams ni lhan skyes zhing sngags skyes rnams so //
analyzed: pho nya ma rnams ni lhan skyes zhing sngags skyes rnams so //
translated: the messengers, who are the innate and mantra-born.

original: yang dag gnas ni pa ni lus ngag yid bde bar skyob pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag gnas ni pa ni lus ngag yid bde bar skyob pa'o //
translated: The true abode is the protection of the bliss of body, speech, and mind.üîΩThe supreme wisdom woman‚Äôs secret nƒÅ·∏çƒ´

original: shes rab ma'i mchog gi gsang rtsa blo ldan rnal 'byor pas /
analyzed: shes rab ma'i mchog gi gsang rtsa blo ldan rnal 'byor pas /
translated: is moved by the wise yogi.

original: mthe chung bskyod pa ni g-yo ngos kyi rdo rje dbyings phyug ma'i rtsa lam du gyur pas /
analyzed: mthe chung bskyod pa ni g-yo ngos kyi rdo rje dbyings phyug ma'i rtsa lam du gyur pas /
translated: The shaking of the little finger is the path of the nƒÅ·∏çƒ´ of VajradhƒÅtvƒ´≈õvarƒ´ of the passion family.

original: bde ba chen por gnas par bya ba gsang ba'i spyod pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen por gnas par bya ba gsang ba'i spyod pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The abiding in great bliss is the secret conduct.

original: yang na d'a ki ma rigs lnga las 'jig rten gyi d'a ki mas tshar bcad rdo rjes 'dzin gyi phrin las byed pa ste /
analyzed: yang na d'a ki ma rigs lnga las 'jig rten gyi d'a ki mas tshar bcad rdo rjes 'dzin gyi phrin las byed pa ste /
translated: Alternatively, among the five families of ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´s, the worldly ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´s are the ones who are conquered.

original: mthe chung lta bu blo ldan gyis bskyod pa ni rnal 'byor pas d'a ki dbang du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mthe chung lta bu blo ldan gyis bskyod pa ni rnal 'byor pas d'a ki dbang du gyur pa'o //
translated: The wise one who moves like the little finger is the yogin who has brought the ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´s under his control.

original: der ni pho nya mo rnams yang dag gnas pa /
analyzed: der ni pho nya mo rnams yang dag gnas pa /
translated: There, the messengers are truly present.

original: phyi nang gi srid pa gsum la gnas nas dngos grub stsol ba'o //
analyzed: phyi nang gi srid pa gsum la gnas nas dngos grub stsol ba'o //
translated: Abiding in the three existences, outer and inner, they grant spiritual powers.

original: da ni 'jig rten gyi gang zag bstan pa la /
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten gyi gang zag bstan pa la /
translated: Now, in the explanation of the mundane person,

original: rgyud 'dir 'jug pa'i gang zag ngos gzung ba'i dbang du byas nas ma dag pa la gnyis las /
analyzed: rgyud 'dir 'jug pa'i gang zag ngos gzung ba'i dbang du byas nas ma dag pa la gnyis las /
translated: from the perspective of identifying the person who enters this tantra, there are two types of impure persons.

original: rang bzhin gyis ma dag pa @73a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ma dag pa @73a * //
translated: The impure by nature

original: dbang po dman pa 'jig rten 'khrul ba'i dbang du song ba dngos 'dzin shas che ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po dman pa 'jig rten 'khrul ba'i dbang du song ba dngos 'dzin shas che ba'o //
translated: is the one of lesser capacity who has fallen under the influence of mundane delusion and has a strong tendency to reify things.

original: ma sbyangs pas ma dag pa /
analyzed: ma sbyangs pas ma dag pa /
translated: The impure by not being trainedüîΩis the beginner who has not been trained by the trainings, the path, and the initiations.

original: las dang po bslab pa dang lam dang dbang gis ma sbyangs pa des ni nyes byed ces /
analyzed: las dang po bslab pa dang lam dang dbang gis ma sbyangs pa des ni nyes byed ces /
translated: He is called ‚Äúthe one who commits faults.‚Äù

original: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang zhing bla ma bsten cing thun mong pa la blo rim gyis sbyang pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang zhing bla ma bsten cing thun mong pa la blo rim gyis sbyang pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: He should train in following faith, relying on the guru, and gradually training the mind in the common path.

original: gnyis pa dag pa ni rang bzhin gyis dad pa shes rab snying rje can /
analyzed: gnyis pa dag pa ni rang bzhin gyis dad pa shes rab snying rje can /
translated: The second, the pure, are those who are naturally endowed with faith, wisdom, and compassion,

original: dngos 'dzin shas chung ba /
analyzed: dngos 'dzin shas chung ba /
translated: who have little tendency to grasp at substantial reality,

original: zab mo la lhag par mos pa'o //
analyzed: zab mo la lhag par mos pa'o //
translated: and who have a special interest in the profound.

original: sbyangs pas dag pa ni bslab pa lam /
analyzed: sbyangs pas dag pa ni bslab pa lam /
translated: The third, the purified through training, are those who follow the path of the precepts,

original: dbang gis smin pas rgyud rnam par dag pa chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba /
analyzed: dbang gis smin pas rgyud rnam par dag pa chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba /
translated: who are matured through empowerment, and whose mind streams are thus purified, and who are followers of the teachings.

original: ye shes myur du skyed rung ba'i gang zag go //
analyzed: ye shes myur du skyed rung ba'i gang zag go //
translated: They are individuals who are suitable for the swift generation of wisdom.

original: de nyid ngo bo nyid kyi yon tan dang ldan pa mi dman pa'i chos la ngang gis gnas so /
analyzed: de nyid ngo bo nyid kyi yon tan dang ldan pa mi dman pa'i chos la ngang gis gnas so /
translated: They are endowed with the qualities of the essence and naturally abide in the teachings that are not inferior.

original: 'dres pa ste zhes pas /
analyzed: 'dres pa ste zhes pas /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúmixed‚Äù refers to

original: dbang po 'bring du gyur pa /
analyzed: dbang po 'bring du gyur pa /
translated: those of middling faculties,

original: rigs ma nges pa /
analyzed: rigs ma nges pa /
translated: those of unfixed potential,

original: rkyen dbang can la /
analyzed: rkyen dbang can la /
translated: and those who are subject to conditions.

original: gsal byed ni grogs bzang po dang ma bral bzhes te /
analyzed: gsal byed ni grogs bzang po dang ma bral bzhes te /
translated: The clarifying factor is that they are not separated from good friends.

original: bsgom pa la 'bad nas lha'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa la nus pa cung zad gsal bar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa la 'bad nas lha'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa la nus pa cung zad gsal bar 'byung ba'o //
translated: If they strive in meditation, they will experience a slight clarity in their ability to engage in the meditative absorption of the deity and so forth.

original: de dag la /
analyzed: de dag la /
translated: With regard to those,

original: sgrub pa po ni gsum du gnas //
analyzed: sgrub pa po ni gsum du gnas //
translated: the practitioner is of three types.

original: zhes pas dbang po rab 'bring gsum du nges pa /
analyzed: zhes pas dbang po rab 'bring gsum du nges pa /
translated: This indicates that they are definitely of three types: best, middling, and least.

original: yang na thos bsam sgom pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na thos bsam sgom pa byed pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is the study, reflection, and meditation.

original: des rgyu'i rgyud du bstan pa yang yin no //
analyzed: des rgyu'i rgyud du bstan pa yang yin no //
translated: This also shows the causal continuum.

original: le'u'i mtshan la /
analyzed: le'u'i mtshan la /
translated: The chapter name:

original: slob ma yongs su brtag pa snod kyi bye brag shes par bya ba dang / sngom pa'i cho ga ni khyad par ni sngom pas dam tshig lag gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: slob ma yongs su brtag pa snod kyi bye brag shes par bya ba dang / sngom pa'i cho ga ni khyad par ni sngom pas dam tshig lag gnas par bya'o //
translated: The examination of the disciple is the knowledge of the various types of vessels, and the rite of the vow is the special observance of the vow.

original: le'u nyer drug pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: le'u nyer drug pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the twenty-sixth chapter.

original: le'u 'dis ni spyod pa gtso bor ston te /
analyzed: le'u 'dis ni spyod pa gtso bor ston te /
translated: This chapter primarily teaches the conduct.

original: de yang le'u dang por /
analyzed: de yang le'u dang por /
translated: Moreover, in the first chapter:

original: mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma ste //
analyzed: mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma ste //
translated: The supreme, middling, and inferior

original: pho nya lhan cig skyes dngos grub /
analyzed: pho nya lhan cig skyes dngos grub /
translated: are the messengers, the innate, and the powers.

original: ces pas mdor bstan la /
analyzed: ces pas mdor bstan la /
translated: This is the brief presentation.

original: rgyas par bshad pa le'u lngas ston pa las spyod pa rang gi ngo bo dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / byed las dang / spyod pa ma byas pa'i skyon dang / spyod pa bya ba'i dus dang / spyod pa'i phan yon bstan pa dang /
analyzed: rgyas par bshad pa le'u lngas ston pa las spyod pa rang gi ngo bo dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / byed las dang / spyod pa ma byas pa'i skyon dang / spyod pa bya ba'i dus dang / spyod pa'i phan yon bstan pa dang /
translated: The extensive explanation is taught by five chapters: the nature of the conduct itself, the definition, the function, the faults of not engaging in the conduct, the time of engaging in the conduct, the benefits of engaging in the conduct,

original: spyod pa'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: spyod pa'i dbye ba'o //
translated: and the divisions of the conduct.

original: de la dang po ni ting nge 'dzin gong nas gong du bogs 'don par byed cing blang dor med pas chos thams cad la ro mnyam pa nyid du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni ting nge 'dzin gong nas gong du bogs 'don par byed cing blang dor med pas chos thams cad la ro mnyam pa nyid du spyod pa'o //
translated: The first of these is the conduct of the yogin who has attained the first stage of the bodhisattva, and who, by enhancing his samadhi more and more, experiences all phenomena as having the same taste, since he has nothing to accept or reject.

original: nus pas gzhan ma dad pa bzlog pas rdo rje theg pa'i che ba ston pa'o //
analyzed: nus pas gzhan ma dad pa bzlog pas rdo rje theg pa'i che ba ston pa'o //
translated: The second is the conduct of the yogin who has attained the second stage, and who, by his power, can turn others away from lack of faith, thus demonstrating the greatness of the Vajrayana.

original: nges pa sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni yo ga ts'a rya ste lha'i brtul zhugs kyi tha mal gyi rtog pa btsan @73b thabs su spyod pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni yo ga ts'a rya ste lha'i brtul zhugs kyi tha mal gyi rtog pa btsan @73b thabs su spyod pa'o //
translated: The reason for the use of the term ‚Äúconduct‚Äù is that yoga-cary a means ‚Äúthe conduct of the deity,‚Äù which is the forceful conduct that eliminates ordinary thoughts.

original: byed las ni bag la nyal rtsa ba nas 'dag la /
analyzed: byed las ni bag la nyal rtsa ba nas 'dag la /
translated: The function of conduct is to purify the latent tendencies from their very roots.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad zil gyis mnan zhing ro snyoms pa dang / rnam shes kyi tshar bcad pa dang / ye shes kyi las kyis bsad pa gso bar nus pas byed pa bstan pa'o //üîΩspyod pa bya ba'i dus tshod ni tshogs lam mngon du gyur nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad zil gyis mnan zhing ro snyoms pa dang / rnam shes kyi tshar bcad pa dang / ye shes kyi las kyis bsad pa gso bar nus pas byed pa bstan pa'o // spyod pa bya ba'i dus tshod ni tshogs lam mngon du gyur nas /
translated: It is also taught that conduct can overcome the eight worldly concerns, equalize tastes, destroy consciousness, and revive those who have been killed by the activity of wisdom.üîΩThe time for engaging in conduct is when the path of accumulation has been actualized.

original: sbyor ba'i lam drod chen po thob nas spyod pa bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam drod chen po thob nas spyod pa bya'o //
translated: Once the path of preparation has been attained, one should engage in conduct.

original: 'di nyid kyi le'u nyer dgu pa las /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi le'u nyer dgu pa las /
translated: This is the meaning of the twenty-ninth chapter of the [Hevajra Tantra]:üîΩAs long as one has not realized the state of heat,

original: ji srid dro ba'i bya ba bdag / mngon par brtson pas rtogs par bya //
analyzed: ji srid dro ba'i bya ba bdag / mngon par brtson pas rtogs par bya //
translated: one should strive to understand it.

original: zhes pa dang / kye'i rdo rje las kyang /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / kye'i rdo rje las kyang /
translated: And the Hevajra Tantra also says:

original: cung zad drod ni thob pa //
analyzed: cung zad drod ni thob pa //
translated: Having attained a little heat,

original: skyod pa 'di ni spyad par bya /üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i don to //
analyzed: skyod pa 'di ni spyad par bya / zhes gsungs pa'i don to //
translated: one should practice the shaking.

original: spyod pa ma byas pa'i skyon ni las kyi sgrib pa myur du mi spong zhing 'bras bu dang rgyar ring bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ma byas pa'i skyon ni las kyi sgrib pa myur du mi spong zhing 'bras bu dang rgyar ring bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The fault of not practicing the conduct is that one will not quickly eliminate the obscurations of karma and the result will be distant.

original: phan yon ni 'bras bu myur du thob pas mtshan nyid theg pa la sogs pa las khyad par du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phan yon ni 'bras bu myur du thob pas mtshan nyid theg pa la sogs pa las khyad par du gyur pa'o //
translated: The benefit is that one will quickly attain the result, and so will be superior to the vehicle of characteristics and so forth.

original: spyod pa'i dbye ba bstan pa la /
analyzed: spyod pa'i dbye ba bstan pa la /
translated: The explanation of the divisions of the conduct is as follows.

original: kun du bzang po dang mgon po kun spyod dang dpal ldan rgyal tshab kyi spyod pa dang / gsang spyod sbas pa'i tshul dang / mnyam gzhag chen po dang / rig pa brtul zhugs dang / phyogs las rnam par rgyal ba'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: kun du bzang po dang mgon po kun spyod dang dpal ldan rgyal tshab kyi spyod pa dang / gsang spyod sbas pa'i tshul dang / mnyam gzhag chen po dang / rig pa brtul zhugs dang / phyogs las rnam par rgyal ba'i spyod pa'o //
translated: There is the conduct of Samantabhadra, the conduct of the protector, the conduct of the glorious regent, the secret conduct of concealment, the great equipoise, the conduct of awareness and discipline, and the conduct of total victory in all ways.

original: rig pa brtul zhugs la gsum ste /
analyzed: rig pa brtul zhugs la gsum ste /
translated: There are three in the spiritual deportment of pure awareness:

original: spros bcas dang / spros med dang / shin tu spros med kyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: spros bcas dang / spros med dang / shin tu spros med kyi spyod pa'o //
translated: the elaborate, unelaborate, and very unelaborate.

original: dang po mdor bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dang po mdor bstan pa ni /
translated: The first is the brief presentation.

original: de nas zhes spyod pa rang gi ngo bo rnal 'byor spyod brtul zhugs zhes smos te thabs dang shes rab dbyer med du sbyor ba lha yab yum la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes spyod pa rang gi ngo bo rnal 'byor spyod brtul zhugs zhes smos te thabs dang shes rab dbyer med du sbyor ba lha yab yum la dmigs pa ste /
translated: Then, the essence of the spiritual deportment is called ‚Äúthe spiritual deportment of the yogic practitioner,‚Äù which refers to the practice of the indivisible union of skillful means and sublime knowing, focusing on the male and female deities.üîΩSince the yogic practitioner of the deity is united with the illusion-like bliss and emptiness, which are nondual, one becomes familiar with the primordial awareness that is connate.üîΩThe spiritual deportment is also considered to be gradual or instantaneous, depending on the practitioner‚Äôs mental engagement.

original: lha'i rnal 'byor bde ba sgyu ma lta bu dang / stong ba nyid gnyis med du sbyor bas lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes la goms par byed pas spyod pa yang rang gi blo'i 'jug pas rim gyis pa dang cig car bar bzhed do //
analyzed: lha'i rnal 'byor bde ba sgyu ma lta bu dang / stong ba nyid gnyis med du sbyor bas lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes la goms par byed pas spyod pa yang rang gi blo'i 'jug pas rim gyis pa dang cig car bar bzhed do //
translated: The spiritual deportment of pure awareness is taught to be of three kinds:

original: rnal 'byor ma kun rab sgrub byed //üîΩces pa las kyi phyag rgya dang chos kyi phyag rgya dang / phyag rgya chen po dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya lus sems grub bde gcig pa la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma kun rab sgrub byed // ces pa las kyi phyag rgya dang chos kyi phyag rgya dang / phyag rgya chen po dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya lus sems grub bde gcig pa la /
translated: elaborate, unelaborate, and very unelaborate.

original: bde ba dang / gsal ba mi rtogs pa /
analyzed: bde ba dang / gsal ba mi rtogs pa /
translated: The elaborate spiritual deportment of pure awareness is taught to be for those of lesser acumen, the unelaborate spiritual deportment for those of middling acumen, and the very unelaborate spiritual deportment for those of greater acumen.üîΩThe elaborate spiritual deportment of pure awareness is taught to be for those of lesser acumen, the unelaborate spiritual deportment for those of middling acumen, and the very unelaborate spiritual deportment for those of greater acumen.üîΩThe elaborate spiritual deportment of pure awareness is taught to be for those of lesser acumen, the unelaborate spiritual deportment for those of middling acumen, and the very unelaborate spiritual deportment for those of greater acumen.

original: ro gcig lhan cig skyes pa mi 'gyur ba rab grub 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ro gcig lhan cig skyes pa mi 'gyur ba rab grub 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One taste is the arising of the connate, unchanging, supreme accomplishment.üîΩThe one who is engaged in the yoga of the two processes

original: dngos grub myur du thob byed pa //
analyzed: dngos grub myur du thob byed pa //
translated: will quickly attain the supreme accomplishment.

original: zhes pas dgongs pa khyad par can par can bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pas dgongs pa khyad par can par can bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the special intention:

original: las chen thams cad dang / dngos grub bla na med pa'i mchog stsol pas bde ba chen pa'o 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: las chen thams cad dang / dngos grub bla na med pa'i mchog stsol pas bde ba chen pa'o 'thob pa'o //
translated: because it bestows all great activities and the supreme, unsurpassed accomplishment, it is great bliss.

original: cho ga thams cad shes par bya //üîΩ@74a * // zhes aa wa dh'u t'i pa'i spyod pa dang / bhu su ku dang / smyon pa lta bu /
analyzed: cho ga thams cad shes par bya // @74a * // zhes aa wa dh'u t'i pa'i spyod pa dang / bhu su ku dang / smyon pa lta bu /
translated: One should know all the rites.

original: nyi ma lta bu la sogs pa mngon du bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyi ma lta bu la sogs pa mngon du bya ba'o //
translated: This is the conduct of the avadh≈´ti, the conduct of the bhusuku, the conduct of the madman, the conduct of the sun, and so on.

original: de yang rim pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor la gnas pas gtsang sbra'i gnas la 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de yang rim pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor la gnas pas gtsang sbra'i gnas la 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach the engagement in the place of cleanliness for one who abides in the yoga of the two processes, it says:

original: phyag rgya sngags bcas sgrub pa pos //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: phyag rgya sngags bcas sgrub pa pos // zhes smos te /
translated: The practitioner with the mudra and mantra

original: bdag dang lha yab yul ldan pa dang / sngags dang / ye shes kyi de kho na nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas /
analyzed: bdag dang lha yab yul ldan pa dang / sngags dang / ye shes kyi de kho na nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas /
translated: One who is endowed with the deity, the male and female, mantra, and the concentration of the reality of wisdom

original: mnyam rjes tha mi dad du gnas par bya zhes so //
analyzed: mnyam rjes tha mi dad du gnas par bya zhes so //
translated: One should abide in the non-differentiation of meditative equipoise and post-meditative attainment.

original: bdag dang lha dbyer med du bya ba'i bsam gtan gyi spyod par yang /
analyzed: bdag dang lha dbyer med du bya ba'i bsam gtan gyi spyod par yang /
translated: The conduct of meditative stabilization in which oneself and the deity are made non-dual is also as follows:

original: mchod pa nyid la rab tu 'jug //
analyzed: mchod pa nyid la rab tu 'jug //
translated: One engages in worship itself.

original: ces pas dbang pos yul la longs spyod pa thabs shes rab gnyis med du rol ba'i bde bas bdag gzhan brtan g-yo khyab pa la'o //
analyzed: ces pas dbang pos yul la longs spyod pa thabs shes rab gnyis med du rol ba'i bde bas bdag gzhan brtan g-yo khyab pa la'o //
translated: With the bliss of the enjoyment of the objects of the senses by the non-dual method and wisdom, one pervades oneself and others, the animate and inanimate.

original: 'di las gzhan pa'i mchod pa med //
analyzed: 'di las gzhan pa'i mchod pa med //
translated: There is no worship other than this.

original: ces phyi dang nang de kho na nyid dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: ces phyi dang nang de kho na nyid dang ldan pas so //
translated: Because of possessing the outer, inner, and suchness worships.

original: de nyid bstan bcos nges pa yin //
analyzed: de nyid bstan bcos nges pa yin //
translated: That itself is the treatise's certainty.

original: zhes sgyu ma bde mchog la sogs par chags sogs rol mo rgya chen po dang ldan pa yang 'dir 'jug pa'i mchog gi spyod pa lha mo nyi shu dang spyod pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes sgyu ma bde mchog la sogs par chags sogs rol mo rgya chen po dang ldan pa yang 'dir 'jug pa'i mchog gi spyod pa lha mo nyi shu dang spyod pa bstan to //
translated: In the Magical Emanation Net Supreme Bliss and so forth, the supreme conduct of engaging in the great enjoyment of desire and so forth is taught as the conduct of the twenty goddesses.

original: bde ba gtso bor sgrub pa ni pho nya'i lam la dga' ba dang ni /
analyzed: bde ba gtso bor sgrub pa ni pho nya'i lam la dga' ba dang ni /
translated: The accomplishment of bliss as the primary [goal] is for those who delight in the path of the messenger.

original: dkyil 'khor 'khor lo'i lam bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'khor lo'i lam bstan pa'o //
translated: The path of the ma·πá·∏çalacakra is taught.

original: mi rtog pa'i ye shes lam du byed pa ni /
analyzed: mi rtog pa'i ye shes lam du byed pa ni /
translated: The path of non-conceptual wisdom is as follows:

original: sgrub pa po ni dngos grub brtson pa /
analyzed: sgrub pa po ni dngos grub brtson pa /
translated: The adept is one who strives for powers.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa rang byin gyis brlab pa'i lam gnas pas so //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa rang byin gyis brlab pa'i lam gnas pas so //
translated: He abides in the path of self-consecration, which is non-conceptual.

original: phyag rgyar yang dag ldan rigs sngags //
analyzed: phyag rgyar yang dag ldan rigs sngags //
translated: Endowed with the seal, the mantra family.

original: lus la shin tu mtshon cha ni go cha gsum bgo ba'o //üîΩrgyas gdab pa dang ldan pa la /
analyzed: lus la shin tu mtshon cha ni go cha gsum bgo ba'o // rgyas gdab pa dang ldan pa la /
translated: The body is well-armed with the three armors.üîΩThe seal is the yoga of the pledge beings and the wisdom beings.

original: rnal 'byor gnas rnam ni byang chub phyogs chos bsam pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gnas rnam ni byang chub phyogs chos bsam pa'o //
translated: The yoga abides in the aspects of enlightenment.

original: nges brtan zhing ni rdo rje 'dzin la gnas pas de kho nyid kyi mchod pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: nges brtan zhing ni rdo rje 'dzin la gnas pas de kho nyid kyi mchod pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'o //
translated: The field is firm, abiding in the vajra holder, and is connected with the offering of reality.

original: yang sngags ni brjod par bya ba bzlas pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: yang sngags ni brjod par bya ba bzlas pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The mantra is the yoga of recitation, which is the expression of the mantra.

original: mngon par phyogs pas gnas par bya ba ni bdud rtsi myang zhing dkyil 'khor nye bar bsdu ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par phyogs pas gnas par bya ba ni bdud rtsi myang zhing dkyil 'khor nye bar bsdu ba bstan pa'o //
translated: The abiding in the facing is shown by the tasting of nectar and the dissolution of the mandala.

original: da ni spyod pa'i de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgrol ba'i don dang bde don du ni rim pa bla na med pa'i bsam gtan la gnas pa @76a * //
analyzed: da ni spyod pa'i de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir / grol ba'i don dang bde don du ni rim pa bla na med pa'i bsam gtan la gnas pa @76a * //
translated: Now, in order to teach the reality of conduct,

original: dang lhan cig skyes pa ye shes kyi rol pa la gnas par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dang lhan cig skyes pa ye shes kyi rol pa la gnas par bya ba'o //
translated: the abiding in the unsurpassed meditative concentration for the sake of liberation and the abiding in the play of the innate intuition for the sake of bliss.

original: de dang ni rig ma'o //
analyzed: de dang ni rig ma'o //
translated: And means and the knowledge woman.

original: lhan cig bde ba bya ba ni dkyil 'khor 'khor lo'i lam bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig bde ba bya ba ni dkyil 'khor 'khor lo'i lam bstan pa'o //
translated: The performance of bliss together with that is the teaching of the path of the mandala wheel.

original: 'di dang lhan cig spyod pa bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lha mo gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pas ye shes la rol pa'i spyod pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dang lhan cig spyod pa bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lha mo gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pas ye shes la rol pa'i spyod pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The performance of conduct together with that is the teaching of the conduct of the play of intuition by means of the goddesses of the sense objects, such as Rupavajra.

original: gzhan dam tshig gi spyod pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan dam tshig gi spyod pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the other, the conduct of commitment, is as follows:

original: mtshon bya rnams ni 'gom mi bya ba ni rdo rje bu la sogs pa lha'i phyag mtshan du gyur pa rnams te /
analyzed: mtshon bya rnams ni 'gom mi bya ba ni rdo rje bu la sogs pa lha'i phyag mtshan du gyur pa rnams te /
translated: The trampling of the symbols is the trampling of the symbols of the deities, such as the vajra child.

original: nang don du rigs lnga'i cha shas kyi rtags dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa la'o //
analyzed: nang don du rigs lnga'i cha shas kyi rtags dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa la'o //
translated: In the inner [system], the practitioner is endowed with the signs of the parts of the five families.

original: rdo rje spun la sogs pa dang rig ma bde chen brgyad dag / dam tshig can la khro mi bya //
analyzed: rdo rje spun la sogs pa dang rig ma bde chen brgyad dag / dam tshig can la khro mi bya //
translated: One should not be angry with those who have the commitments, such as vajra siblings and the eight yoginƒ´s of great bliss.

original: zhes bsrung ba'i dam tshig la gnas par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bsrung ba'i dam tshig la gnas par bya ba bstan to //
translated: This teaches the need to abide in the commitments of protection.

original: da ni brtul zhugs kyi spyod pa ji ltar spyod pa bstan pa la /
analyzed: da ni brtul zhugs kyi spyod pa ji ltar spyod pa bstan pa la /
translated: Now, the conduct of spiritual deportment is taught.

original: mtshan mo rtag par nam mkha'i gos ni rnal 'byor pa dang rig ma dag dur khro dang du rgyu zhing gcer bur bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo rtag par nam mkha'i gos ni rnal 'byor pa dang rig ma dag dur khro dang du rgyu zhing gcer bur bya ba'o //
translated: The yogƒ´ and yoginƒ´ should always wander in the charnel grounds at night, naked, wearing the sky as clothing.

original: gang dang dmar bar rtags bsgyur bya ba lus rnal ma mi shes par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: gang dang dmar bar rtags bsgyur bya ba lus rnal ma mi shes par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: One should change one‚Äôs appearance and dress in a way that is not recognized.

original: nang don du dpal he ru ka dang rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i nga rgyal du bya ba'o //
analyzed: nang don du dpal he ru ka dang rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i nga rgyal du bya ba'o //
translated: In the inner [system], one should have the pride of ≈örƒ´ Heruka and Vajrayoginƒ´.

original: gos kyi bye brag ji ltar bgo ba ni /üîΩsrod chags yan lag las byung gyon //
analyzed: gos kyi bye brag ji ltar bgo ba ni / srod chags yan lag las byung gyon //
translated: The way to wear the different garments is as follows.

original: zhes pa glang chen zhing lpags stong g-yogs snam sbyar /
analyzed: zhes pa glang chen zhing lpags stong g-yogs snam sbyar /
translated: One should wear the elephant hide, the flayed human skin, and the apron

original: smad la dur khrod ras dang stag gi sham thabs dang ldan pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa'i gos 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: smad la dur khrod ras dang stag gi sham thabs dang ldan pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa'i gos 'chang ba'o //
translated: The lower garment is the consecration of the cloth from the charnel ground and the tiger-skin skirt.

original: bde ba 'dod pas bde thob 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: bde ba 'dod pas bde thob 'gyur ba ni /
translated: One who desires bliss will attain bliss.

original: zag bcas kyi bde ba la brten nas zag med ye shes kyi bde ba dam pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: zag bcas kyi bde ba la brten nas zag med ye shes kyi bde ba dam pa thob pa'o //
translated: By relying on contaminated bliss, one attains the sublime bliss of uncontaminated wisdom.

original: da ni phyag rgya drug gi rgyan 'chang bas rgyas gdab pa bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩphyi rol bas btags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni phyag rgya drug gi rgyan 'chang bas rgyas gdab pa bstan pa'i phyir / phyi rol bas btags pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the consecration by wearing the ornaments of the six mudras,üîΩit is said:

original: mchod phyir thogs pa ni yongs spangs gtsang zhes pa /
analyzed: mchod phyir thogs pa ni yongs spangs gtsang zhes pa /
translated: The outer one is abandoned, and the inner one is pure.

original: dpal bde chen ye shes kyi rgyan tshangs skud bsgril ma 'chang bas a'a li k'a lis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: dpal bde chen ye shes kyi rgyan tshangs skud bsgril ma 'chang bas a'a li k'a lis brgyan pa'o //
translated: The glorious wisdom of great bliss is adorned with the twisted sacred thread of the brahmins, and it is adorned with the ƒÅlikƒÅli.

original: shr'i he ru kas byin gyis brlab pa ni /
analyzed: shr'i he ru kas byin gyis brlab pa ni /
translated: The consecration by ≈örƒ´ Heruka

original: rigs drug pa'i bdag nyid kyis so //üîΩphyag rgya lnga dang yang dag ldan ni dpal rdo rje rnal 'byor ma la drug pa thal chen gyis byug pa med de /
analyzed: rigs drug pa'i bdag nyid kyis so // phyag rgya lnga dang yang dag ldan ni dpal rdo rje rnal 'byor ma la drug pa thal chen gyis byug pa med de /
translated: is by the nature of the six families.

original: rigs lngas rgyas gdab pa nyid do //
analyzed: rigs lngas rgyas gdab pa nyid do //
translated: Possessing the five mudras is the seal of the five families on glorious Vajrayoginƒ´, without the smearing of the sixth, the great ash.

original: lam bsgom pa'i dus su ni sngags brjod pa nyid rgyan du 'gyur bas yang dus kun du spros bcas la sogs par de dag thams cad du ni yang dag spyad pa rgyan @76b sngags dang lha'i rgyas gdab mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: lam bsgom pa'i dus su ni sngags brjod pa nyid rgyan du 'gyur bas yang dus kun du spros bcas la sogs par de dag thams cad du ni yang dag spyad pa rgyan @76b sngags dang lha'i rgyas gdab mtshon pa'o //
translated: At the time of meditating on the path, since the recitation of mantra itself is an ornament, all of those are ornaments of correct conduct in all contexts, such as elaborate [conduct], and so on.

original: da ni dpa' bo'i phyag rgya drug bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dpa' bo'i phyag rgya drug bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the six mudras of the hero,

original: mgul rgyan ni rdo rje rnal 'byor 'byor ma'i rtsa ba'i sngags kyis tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa /
analyzed: mgul rgyan ni rdo rje rnal 'byor 'byor ma'i rtsa ba'i sngags kyis tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa /
translated: the necklace is the perfection of ethics with the root mantra of Vajrayoginƒ´.

original: gdu bu dang dpung rgyan dpa' bo lnga'i go cha'i sngags kyis sbyin pa /
analyzed: gdu bu dang dpung rgyan dpa' bo lnga'i go cha'i sngags kyis sbyin pa /

original: rna ba'i rgyan ni he ru ka'i nye ba'i snying pos bzod pa /
analyzed: rna ba'i rgyan ni he ru ka'i nye ba'i snying pos bzod pa /
translated: The ear ornaments are patience with the essence mantra of Heruka.üîΩThe head is adorned with a wheel and possesses five skulls, which is the perfection of diligence with Vajro·π£·πáƒ´·π£a.

original: spyi bor 'khor los rnam par brgyan pa thod pa lnga dang ldan pa ni rdo rje rnam snang mdzad mas brtson 'grus tshangs ba'i skud pa ni thogs med ldan te /
analyzed: spyi bor 'khor los rnam par brgyan pa thod pa lnga dang ldan pa ni rdo rje rnam snang mdzad mas brtson 'grus tshangs ba'i skud pa ni thogs med ldan te /

analyzed: dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i rtsa sngags kyis so mo do ste sna tshogs nor bu'i do shal 'chang bas te zhabs gdub dang bcas pa'o //

original: ska rags 'og pag sil sil sgra sgrogs pa ni /
analyzed: ska rags 'og pag sil sil sgra sgrogs pa ni /

original: mgo bo'i phreng bas mgul du dbyangs pa ni /

analyzed: bdud ris bsgral ba'i thod pa rlon pa lnga bcu'i phreng ba ste /

original: shr'i he ru ka'i snying pos byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: shr'i he ru ka'i snying pos byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: He is consecrated by the essence of Sri Heruka.

original: dpa' bo'i lus thal chen gyis khyab par byug pa ni /
analyzed: dpa' bo'i lus thal chen gyis khyab par byug pa ni /
translated: The hero's body is smeared with great ash,

analyzed: h'um sgra sgrogs pa ni bdud tshogs zil gyis gnon / par mdzad pa'o // dus kun du ni rnam par gnas pa ni /

original: thog ma bar dang tha ma kun du rig pa brtul zhugs kyi spyod pa ste /
analyzed: thog ma bar dang tha ma kun du rig pa brtul zhugs kyi spyod pa ste /

original: aom shr'i sarba ta th'a ga ta dzny'a na ku las mutstsha badzra adhishtha na sa ma ya stv'am ces thams cad bde chen ye shes gcig pa'i ngo bor sngom pa'o //
analyzed: aom shr'i sarba ta th'a ga ta dzny'a na ku las mutstsha badzra adhishtha na sa ma ya stv'am ces thams cad bde chen ye shes gcig pa'i ngo bor sngom pa'o //
translated: O·πÉ ≈õrƒ´ sarva tathƒÅgata j√±ƒÅna ku la mu tsa vajra adhi·π£·π≠hƒÅna samaya stva·πÉ‚Äîall are the essence of the single pristine consciousness of great bliss.

analyzed: mtshan mo rtag par gsal bya zhing ni dur khrod la sogs par rgyu bar mos pa bya ba rje btsun mas byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: Always illuminate the night, and imagine traveling to the charnel grounds, and so on.

analyzed: nyin par gsal ba nyid du bya ba dpal he ru ka'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas dus byin gyis brlabs pa rnam dag bstan pa'o //

original: dpa' bo rnal 'byor go chas brgyan //
analyzed: dpa' bo rnal 'byor go chas brgyan //

analyzed: zhes pa ni thabs kyi go cha /

original: shes rab kyi go cha /
analyzed: shes rab kyi go cha /

analyzed: go cha chen po dag gis rab tu brgyan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One will be adorned with the great armor.

analyzed: des brtul zhugs kyi spyod pa'i de kho na nyid bstan cing /

original: da ni bden pa gnyis dag pa'i don la /

translated: Now, in the meaning of the two pure truths,

translated: the gnosis of division is very hidden.üîΩThe gnosis of entry is relative gnosis.

analyzed: 'jug pa kun rdzob kyi ye shes las ldog pa don dam pa'i ye shes / dag pa @77a * //
translated: The reversal of that is ultimate gnosis.

original: 'jig rten pa las /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa las /
translated: The pure mundane gnosis is the gnosis of the two truths.üîΩThe ultimate gnosis is the gnosis of the two truths.üîΩThe ultimate gnosis is the gnosis of the two truths.üîΩThe ultimate gnosis is the gnosis of the two truths.üîΩThe ultimate gnosis is the gnosis of the two truths.

analyzed: dpe don gyis byed pas lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes ngos gzung ba bstan te /

original: dang po ni thun mong gi gtsang sbra bya ba dang / spyod pa'i rgyud bzhin du rnam par gnas pa ni /
analyzed: dang po ni thun mong gi gtsang sbra bya ba dang / spyod pa'i rgyud bzhin du rnam par gnas pa ni /
translated: The ultimate gnosis is the gnosis of the two truths.

original: nye reg dang mthor 'thung la sogs pa lhar mos pa tsam dang rig sngags kyi bzlas brjod tsam gyis gang zag gi lus ngag yid dag par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: nye reg dang mthor 'thung la sogs pa lhar mos pa tsam dang rig sngags kyi bzlas brjod tsam gyis gang zag gi lus ngag yid dag par byed pa yin la /
translated: The purification of the individual's body, speech, and mind is accomplished by mere devotion to the deity and mere recitation of the knowledge mantra in the Action Tantra, through such acts as the near attainment and the drinking of the nectar.

original: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud bzhin du lce dang lag pa byin gyis brlab pa nas sgo gsum nus pa mthu ldan du byin gyis rlob pa dang / go bgo zhing bka' nan bcing ba la sogs pas dag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud bzhin du lce dang lag pa byin gyis brlab pa nas sgo gsum nus pa mthu ldan du byin gyis rlob pa dang / go bgo zhing bka' nan bcing ba la sogs pas dag par byed pa'o //
translated: In the Yoga Tantra, the purification is accomplished by the consecration of the tongue and the hand, and so forth, and by the consecration of the three doors to be endowed with the power of ability, and by the donning of the armor, the binding of the command seal, and so forth.

original: khyad par gsang ba bla na med pa'i rgyud 'di nyid bzhin lha dang ye shes gnyis med lhan cig skyes pa'i rnam par gnas pas /
analyzed: khyad par gsang ba bla na med pa'i rgyud 'di nyid bzhin lha dang ye shes gnyis med lhan cig skyes pa'i rnam par gnas pas /
translated: In particular, in this very Tantra of the Unsurpassed Secret, the deity and the pristine awareness are nondual, abiding in the innate nature.

original: thabs shes rab gnyis med kyi bde ba bsgrub pa'i don gyis bde stong dang ma bral bar spyod pas ye shes la gnas par bya ba'o //
analyzed: thabs shes rab gnyis med kyi bde ba bsgrub pa'i don gyis bde stong dang ma bral bar spyod pas ye shes la gnas par bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, by the practice of never being separated from the bliss and emptiness which is the meaning of accomplishing the bliss of the nondual method and wisdom, one abides in the pristine awareness.

original: rigs dang ni zhes rang rig gi nang don gyi lha dang sngags las byung ba dang / rigs mi te gzhan pa'i lha phyi'i sngags las byung ba'i yul spang blang gi ngor mi blta bar thams cad gsang chen rigs gcig tu gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs dang ni zhes rang rig gi nang don gyi lha dang sngags las byung ba dang / rigs mi te gzhan pa'i lha phyi'i sngags las byung ba'i yul spang blang gi ngor mi blta bar thams cad gsang chen rigs gcig tu gnas par bya'o //
translated: The line and family refers to the inner deity and mantra that arise from self-awareness and the outer deity and mantra that arise from other. One should not look at all of these in terms of objects to adopt or abandon, but rather abide in the single family of the great secret.

original: pho nya'i gtsang sba dang po yin //
analyzed: pho nya'i gtsang sba dang po yin //
translated: The first is the purity of the messenger.

original: zhes pa la don khyad par du byed pa la bzhi ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la don khyad par du byed pa la bzhi ste /
translated: This has four topics:

original: bum dbang lha'i rnal 'byor gyi pho nya dang / gsang dbang bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i pho nya dang / dbang gsum pa rang rig pa'i pho nya dang / bzhi pa rang rig pa'i skyes bu ye shes kyi pho nya bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bum dbang lha'i rnal 'byor gyi pho nya dang / gsang dbang bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i pho nya dang / dbang gsum pa rang rig pa'i pho nya dang / bzhi pa rang rig pa'i skyes bu ye shes kyi pho nya bstan pa'o //
translated: the messenger of the vase empowerment, the deity yoga; the messenger of the secret empowerment, the self-empowerment; the messenger of the third empowerment, self-awareness; and the messenger of the fourth empowerment, the gnosis being of self-awareness.

original: gnyis pa zhi ba'i btung ba yin //
analyzed: gnyis pa zhi ba'i btung ba yin //
translated: The second is the drink of peace.

original: gnyis pas 'chi med pa dud rtsi myang ba /
analyzed: gnyis pas 'chi med pa dud rtsi myang ba /

analyzed: gsum pas bde chen to mnyam du btung ba /

analyzed: gnyis pas gsal stong gnyis med ro mnyam du za ba /
translated: The second is to eat the nondual equality of clarity and emptiness.

original: gsum pas bde stong gnyis med ro mnyam du za ba /
analyzed: gsum pas bde stong gnyis med ro mnyam du za ba /

analyzed: bzhi pas dngos po dang dngos med thams cad phyag rgya chen po lhan cig skyes pa'i rang du za ba'o //

analyzed: gtsang sbra 'di dag rab bskyangs pas //

analyzed: gnas dang bcas ni phyi'i gnas sa 'og sa steng bla ba'i gnas so //
translated: The place is the outer place, the place of the sky, the place of the earth, and the place below the earth.

original: nang du lus kyi gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi la sogs par gnas nas dpa' bo dang lhan cig bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: nang du lus kyi gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi la sogs par gnas nas dpa' bo dang lhan cig bcas pa rnams so //

analyzed: der rnal 'byor pas rdo rje'i lus la brten nas gnad bcings pas /

original: rlung drag tu chun pas rtsa yi ge pu dz'a ao aa la sogs pa la gnad du bsnun pas /
analyzed: rlung drag tu chun pas rtsa yi ge pu dz'a ao aa la sogs pa la gnad du bsnun pas /
translated: Since the vƒÅyu is strongly constricted, the vital points of the nƒÅ·∏çƒ´s, the syllables, pu ja o a, and so on, are struck.

original: rlung sems gcig tu 'dres pas lus gnad rtsa'i mkha' 'gro ma thams cad yi ge'i rnam par @80b dbang du 'dus 'byung ba bzhi rlung m'a ma k'i sogs phrin las la dbang byed pas gsang sngags lam du byas //

translated: Since the four elements, the vƒÅyus, MƒÅmakƒ´, and so on, are controlled in the activities, secret mantra is employed as the path.

original: thig le byang chub sems bde ba skye ba'i tshul du kun 'dar du byang sems dkar dmar gnyis med du dbang byas pas dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad sgrub pa po'i bka' nyan cing 'dun par byed do //
analyzed: thig le byang chub sems bde ba skye ba'i tshul du kun 'dar du byang sems dkar dmar gnyis med du dbang byas pas dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad sgrub pa po'i bka' nyan cing 'dun par byed do //
translated: Since the bindu, bodhicitta, is controlled in the avadh≈´ti as the mode of the arising of bliss, all heroes and yoginƒ´s listen to the words of the practitioner and gather.

original: der rlung las su rung bas phyi nang gi rlung gnyis 'dres te dang por drod skye /
analyzed: der rlung las su rung bas phyi nang gi rlung gnyis 'dres te dang por drod skye /
translated: Since the vƒÅyu is workable, the outer and inner vƒÅyus blend. First, heat arises.

original: de las bde ba /
analyzed: de las bde ba /
translated: From that, bliss arises.

original: de las rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin skye ste /
analyzed: de las rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin skye ste /
translated: From that, nonconceptual samƒÅdhi arises.

original: lus mgo zhabs thams cad khyad par bde ba mi bzod pa 'chad /
analyzed: lus mgo zhabs thams cad khyad par bde ba mi bzod pa 'chad /
translated: The entire body, from head to toe, is pervaded by unbearable bliss.

original: de yang nang gnas gsum gyi rnal 'byor ma rnams rtsa'i rnam par bzhugs pa dang / dpa' bo rnams so so'i khams byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le rgyas shing 'bar bas /
analyzed: de yang nang gnas gsum gyi rnal 'byor ma rnams rtsa'i rnam par bzhugs pa dang / dpa' bo rnams so so'i khams byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le rgyas shing 'bar bas /

original: spyod dang grol ba'i 'bras rab ster //
analyzed: spyod dang grol ba'i 'bras rab ster //
translated: The result of conduct and liberation is granted.

original: zhes der drod dang bde ba mi rtog pa'i ye shes rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'char ba yang /
analyzed: zhes der drod dang bde ba mi rtog pa'i ye shes rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'char ba yang /
translated: At that time, heat, bliss, and the nonconceptual gnosis that arises in dependence on the interdependent connections are

original: rnal 'byor ma dang dpa' bo thabs shes rab gnyis med kyis rang byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma dang dpa' bo thabs shes rab gnyis med kyis rang byin gyis brlabs pa ste /

original: phyi nang gi rten 'brel dang 'grig tu 'ong ste /
analyzed: phyi nang gi rten 'brel dang 'grig tu 'ong ste /

analyzed: bde stong ro gcig pa'i ye shes rnal ma dus de tsam na 'byung //
translated: The natural gnosis of the single taste of bliss and emptiness arises at that time.

original: spyod pa yang 'jig rten chos brgyad zil gyis gnon pa bu chung ltar zhen pa med pa'i dad las rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu rab tu thob pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi ma dad pa zlog nus //

translated: The result of conduct is the ability to overpower the eight worldly preoccupations, like a small child, free from attachment and faithlessness.

original: sngags kyi nus pa thog lta bu thogs pa med par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi nus pa thog lta bu thogs pa med par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The power of the mantra arises like lightning, without obstruction.

original: de las mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'bras bu bla na med pa kun sgrub byed pa'o //
analyzed: de las mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'bras bu bla na med pa kun sgrub byed pa'o //
translated: From that, the highest fruit of the desired aim is accomplished.

original: rig sngags kyi snying po nyid yin te /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi snying po nyid yin te /
translated: It is the essence of the knowledge mantra.

original: rtsa ba'i sngags ni rtag tu zlos //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sngags ni rtag tu zlos //
translated: The root mantra is always repeated.

original: zhes pas dpal he ru ka'i snying po'i sngags la /
analyzed: zhes pas dpal he ru ka'i snying po'i sngags la /

original: aom ka ra ka ra la sogs pa rnams thun bzhi la sogs par bsnyen pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: aom ka ra ka ra la sogs pa rnams thun bzhi la sogs par bsnyen pa byed pa'o //
translated: One should do the recitation in four sessions, etc.

original: de yang rtsa ba zhes yon tan ma lus pa'i byung gnas shes pas skyob pa dang / yid skyob par byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: de yang rtsa ba zhes yon tan ma lus pa'i byung gnas shes pas skyob pa dang / yid skyob par byed pa'i don to //
translated: Moreover, since the root is known as the source of all good qualities, it has the meaning of protecting and protecting the mind.

original: de yang lha'i rnal 'byor dus ni khyogs lta bu dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo ltar dang / mnga'i shugs lta bu la sogs par bzlas la /
analyzed: de yang lha'i rnal 'byor dus ni khyogs lta bu dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo ltar dang / mnga'i shugs lta bu la sogs par bzlas la /
translated: Moreover, one should repeat the mantra in the yoga of the deity like a palanquin, like a whirling firebrand, like the speed of an arrow, and so on.

original: de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa ltar na bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba'i shes rab kyi padmar gnas pa'i rdo rje bum pa'i cha las sngags kyi rnam pa mu tig gi rnam pa lta bu la phreng ba ltar dmigs par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa ltar na bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba'i shes rab kyi padmar gnas pa'i rdo rje bum pa'i cha las sngags kyi rnam pa mu tig gi rnam pa lta bu la phreng ba ltar dmigs par bya ba nyid do //
translated: According to the offering of reality, one should visualize the form of the mantra, like a pearl, from the part of the vase of the vajra abiding in the lotus of wisdom which experiences great bliss.

original: bdud kun rab tu zhi bar byed //üîΩces pa ni lha'i bu'i bdud @81a * //
analyzed: bdud kun rab tu zhi bar byed // ces pa ni lha'i bu'i bdud @81a * //

original: g-yengs ba la spros pa med pa sa zhi //
analyzed: g-yengs ba la spros pa med pa sa zhi //

original: phung po'i bdung skyu ma rmi lam ltar gyur pas zhi /
analyzed: phung po'i bdung skyu ma rmi lam ltar gyur pas zhi /

original: 'chi bdag gi chos thams cad skye 'gag med par rtogs pas zhi //
analyzed: 'chi bdag gi chos thams cad skye 'gag med par rtogs pas zhi //
translated: The demon of death is pacified by realizing that all phenomena are unborn and unceasing.

analyzed: nyon mangs pa ni thams cad 'od gsal bde ba chen por gyur bas rab tu zhi bar gyur ba ste /
translated: All afflictions are completely pacified by becoming luminosity, great bliss.

original: shin tu rab tu zhi bar gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu rab tu zhi bar gyur ba nyid do //
translated: They are completely pacified, completely pacified.

original: rgyu dang mi rgyu ni brtan g-yo ma lus pa gzhal yas khang dang lha'i skyil 'khor du snang ba'i 'jig rten srid pa gsum thams cad kyi yon tan la dbang phyug tu gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang mi rgyu ni brtan g-yo ma lus pa gzhal yas khang dang lha'i skyil 'khor du snang ba'i 'jig rten srid pa gsum thams cad kyi yon tan la dbang phyug tu gyur ba'o //
translated: The moving and unmoving are all the animate and inanimate [world] appearing as the immeasurable palace and the circle of deities.

original: de dag gi nus pa bla na med pa thob pa'i rnal 'byor rol bas ni /
analyzed: de dag gi nus pa bla na med pa thob pa'i rnal 'byor rol bas ni /
translated: The yogic play of attaining the unsurpassed power of those [deities] is
